text: It was an honor to welcome Texas Agriculture Commissioner Sid Miller to my Washington office this week! We discussed the importance of ensuring our farmers and ranchers can secure their livelihoods for generations to come. TX-17 is home to some of the finest farms and ranches in the state, and I am proud to represent our hardworking members of the agricultural community.
Happy Birthday, @SFASU! Axe 'Em Jacks!

Today, I discussed my bill to abolish the DC Judicial Nomination Commission with Mayor Bowser, AG Schwalb, and Council Chairman Mendleson in an @GOPoversight hearing. Public safety in our capital is a national priority. By filling court vacancies faster, we are strengthening the DC courts to deliver justice, hold criminals accountable, and ensure DC residents and visitors are safe.
🚨Watch now🚨
Proud to announce that my bill to strengthen the DC court system has just passed out of the House! https://t.co/TzyegfTAWz

Our nation’s capital should be safe. My bill strengthens the DC judicial system, ensuring law enforcement can do its job and the courts can deliver justice. As the son of a federal judge, I have a great respect for the judiciary and the process Constitutionally ordained to ensure fairness and hold criminals accountable. We must take action to give the courts the tools they need to do their job and get criminals off the streets.

On this day in 1787, the United States Constitution was adopted, laying the cornerstone of our great nation. The principles of the Constitution have guided America for generations and continue to inspire the work of forming a more perfect Union. Today, we celebrate this founding achievement to secure the blessings of liberty for all Americans.

I enjoyed speaking this morning at @politico's AI & Tech Summit. It was great to share my perspective and to hear from administration leaders and industry experts on the transformative potential of AI, particularly in data organization and government technology. The federal government has an important role in the development of how AI technology is used and regulated. I look forward to the opportunities ahead as we continue exploring how AI can drive innovation and improve government services.

As an honorary advisor to America’s Future Series, I was pleased to recognize Admiral William McRaven, recipient of the Megellas Award, for his extraordinary service to our nation, both in uniform and as a civilian, and Bob Pragada, recipient of the 5 Star Award, for his outstanding support of our military and vital national security initiatives as a business leader.
 
American excellence is made possible by leaders like Admiral McRaven and Mr. Pragada. Congratulations to both on these well-deserved achievements!

I was proud to host a successful Central Texas U.S. Service Academy Forum this afternoon! 

Thank you to everyone who joined us to learn more about pursuing a future at one of our nation’s prestigious service academies. It was inspiring to meet so many bright and driven young leaders dedicated to serving our country. Your enthusiasm and commitment give me great hope, the future is in good hands. 🇺🇸

24 years ago, our nation was forever changed. Out of unimaginable tragedy came extraordinary acts of American courage, strength, and sacrifice. Today, we honor the heroes of 9/11 and remember the lives lost. May we never forget. https://t.co/IKwm6zNWGQ

I am deeply shocked and horrified by the tragedy in Utah today, and heartbroken to learn of the passing of Charlie Kirk. Charlie was a man whose conviction and passion will leave a lasting mark on an entire generation. His loss will be felt deeply across our nation. Politically motivated violence has no place in America, and I unequivocally condemn any individual who believes such actions can be justified. Please join me in praying for the Kirk family and all those close to this great man during this time of immense loss.
Please join me in praying for Charlie Kirk.
🚨Tune in NOW on @NewsCentralCNN @JohnBerman https://t.co/R6n4suJ2vZ

THIS WEEKEND: Join us in Round Rock for the 2025 Central Texas Service Academy Forum on Saturday, September 13, an informational event co-hosted by the Offices of Senator Cruz, Senator Cornyn, Congressman Sessions (TX-17), Congressman McCaul (TX-10), Congressman Carter (TX-31), and Congressman Doggett (TX-37).

Learn about the nomination process, speak with academy representatives, and get your questions answered.

For more information, contact Tori Magers from the Office of Congressman Pete Sessions at (254) 633-4500 or tori.magers@mail.house.gov.

I was saddened to hear of the passing of Judge Alvin Jones. A retired Major General in the U.S. Army and former Brazos County Judge, Judge Jones dedicated his life to the service of his country, community, and family. It was an honor to work alongside him in Brazos County and to call him a friend. His legacy of leadership and kindness will be long remembered. My prayers are with his loved ones.

With Congress back in full swing, we are continuing our investigation into the Epstein files in the House Oversight Committee. Following his success in turning crime around in the work free drug zone known as Washington, President Trump wants to improve safety in Chicago. Washington is moving fast, and there’s no shortage of work to do. I enjoyed discussing the day's headlines with @LinseyDavis on @ABCNewsLive last night.

Congress is back in Washington for legislative business. I began my morning on @CNN to discuss with @JohnBerman what's ahead this week on the Hill. Oversight will continue pursuing answers in the Epstein files to ensure full transparency and accountability. I look forward to working with my colleagues to keep this priority moving forward.
🚨Tune in on @CNN NOW🚨 https://t.co/Ck4gZxXsb4

Happy Labor Day, TX-17! Our workforce is strong, supported by the wealth of opportunities for work and training offered through our outstanding schools. You are the backbone of our economy, and I’m proud to celebrate your contributions today. https://t.co/VBFIM6TTxs

This week in Waco, I joined L3Harris Technologies to celebrate the opening of their production facility for the U.S. Air Force OA-1K Skyraider II.

A strong partner to the City of Waco, L3Harris has chosen this location as the hub for this next-generation aircraft. This investment represents more than advanced manufacturing and innovation; it’s a vote of confidence in Central Texas. The Skyraider II program will not only revolutionize capabilities on the battlefield but also strengthen our local economy.

TX-17's workforce is excellent, and I am proud that what we build here in Texas will have a global impact.

I sent @AGPamBondi a letter urging DOJ to reject marijuana rescheduling. The data is clear: marijuana is a dangerous drug that has only become more dangerous over time. We must protect our children from predatory marijuana businesses that want to make them addicted consumers for life. 

See more here: https://t.co/2AjFMFSsll

Yesterday, I was proud to announce that the EPA is awarding $1 million to the City of @HuntsvilleTexas for critical Wastewater Treatment Plant rehabilitation. This investment will expand water capacity to support Huntsville’s growing population while protecting water quality in Lake Conroe and Elkins Lake. I’m grateful my request worked to secure this funding, which will provide essential infrastructure improvements and strengthen the future of this beautiful community.

The American system is built on the rule of law, and no public official should ever engage in fraud. As I told @ABCNewsLive yesterday, the allegations against Lisa Cook must be resolved through the proper legal process. The American people deserve accountability. https://t.co/PkZ1rWyREm

The American people expect and deserve accountability from every public official. Fraud is unacceptable, and those entrusted with public responsibility must follow the law. I told @FoxBusiness  that the @FinancialCmte will thoroughly review the allegations against Lisa Cook to ensure integrity and accountability in service to the public.

Yesterday, I joined Senator @JohnCornyn at @SFASU for a roundtable with SFA students, @SFASU_President, and leaders from @angelinacollege, @kilgorecollege, @PanolaCollege, @TylerJrCollege, and @WorkforceDETex.

We discussed how Congress is working to strengthen workforce training so East Texans can pursue higher education and meet the needs of our growing economy.

Thank you to @SFASU for hosting and for your leadership in driving record enrollment and preparing the next generation of Texas leaders. #AxeEm

Great to be behind the Pine Curtain yesterday with the Nacogdoches County Chamber of Commerce. I appreciated the opportunity to visit with local leaders and business owners about the challenges they face and the opportunities ahead. The future is bright for Nacogdoches, and it is an honor to represent this community in Congress.

Allied Steel is leading the way in workforce development and advanced manufacturing right here in Central Texas. Their innovative use of manufacturing machinery with American-made steel is transforming production and setting new standards in the industry. I enjoyed touring their McGregor facility yesterday and look forward to seeing how they will continue to strengthen our community and shape the future of manufacturing.

It was a pleasure to be in Walker County to speak at the Meals on Wheels Banquet! This organization does incredible work serving our community, and it was an honor to join in recognizing their dedication and impact. An evening well spent celebrating such a worthy cause. https://t.co/PIwkQdrLp7

Yesterday, I was honored to receive the Eagle Award from Associated Builders and Contractors Central Texas in recognition of my voting record in support of the contracting community. Builders and contractors are essential to our economy by driving workforce development and building the communities we call home. I am committed to continuing my support of the contracting community in Congress.

Do you know a veteran who goes above and beyond for our community in TX-17? Nominations are closing next week for the 2025 Congressional Veteran Commendation, an honor recognizing the outstanding service and continued civic contributions of local veterans. If you know someone deserving, please visit https://t.co/26PLsc8c0S to learn more and submit a nomination.

Recently, I hosted my second Central Texas Coordinated School Safety Meeting.

Leaders from across Central Texas, including law enforcement, school superintendents, and County Judges from McLennan, Limestone, Falls, Milam, Freestone, Bosque, and Hill Counties, joined the discussion.

As we prepare for the coming school year, we are reminded that keeping our students and educators safe is a shared responsibility. Strengthening communication between schools and law enforcement is key, and I remain committed to addressing safety threats and protecting our schools.

It has been a pleasure to have our Summer 2025 Congressional Intern cohort in my office. These students represent some of the very best of what our country has to offer and I look forward to seeing what the future holds for them. Thank you for your service to TX-17! https://t.co/vLS3K6R8JM

Yesterday, I had the privilege of speaking at Eagles on the Hill with Scouting America. As an Eagle Scout, the son of an Eagle Scout, and a proud father of two Eagle Scouts, I am a strong believer in the transformative experience Scouting can be for young people.

Gathering fellow Eagle Scouts in Congress reminded us all why Scouting’s timeless values, embodied in the Scout Law, continue to guide us in service, leadership, and community.

In fiscal year 2024, the federal government spent $755 billion on contracts. In order to achieve the best results for taxpayers, we need to seek improvements regarding the contracting bid protest process to ensure efficiency and prevent the exploitation of loopholes. Today, my subcommittee on Government Operations on @GOPoversight held a hearing with experts on the subject to review how we can conduct oversight of this process. While complex, the bid protest process is extremely important to how the federal government conducts business.

Proud to share that two of my key defense funding priorities were included in the FY26 Defense Appropriations bill, without increasing overall spending. This is a strategic shift in how existing funds are prioritized to better protect our national security.

SMART Hub research at @Baylor University will receive funding to advance cutting-edge RF and radar technologies. These innovations will enhance spectrum dominance on the battlefield and improve safety for our service members.

Additionally, funding was reallocated for a Department of Defense initiative to improve microelectronics security. This investment will fund a proof-of-concept for embedding unalterable security markings directly onto chips, marking a critical step toward full-spectrum semiconductor assurance across both our defense and critical infrastructure.

This bill demonstrates that we can make smart, future-focused investments in national defense by focusing resources where they’re needed most.

Great to welcome the @bgcdet_tx into my office! This outstanding after-school program gives students a supportive space to receive academic help, be active and competitive through athletics, and build relationships with peers and mentors.  Proud of the work they are doing to strengthen the next generation.

This morning on @CNN @CNNSitRoom with @wolfblitzer and @PamelaBrownCNN, I discussed the state of our economy and other headline items. This Administration is committed to keeping the American Dream alive by fostering a strong, resilient economy, one that is grounded in the strength and stability of the Federal Reserve. In Congress, our responsibility is to ensure the government has the people and resources it needs to deliver real results for the American people.

Last weekend, I was on the ground in Kerrville with the President, Secretary Noem, Secretary Turner, Secretary Rollins, Administrator Loeffler, and Members of the Texas delegation to hear from families and local officials following the devastating floods.

As Chairman of the Subcommittee on Government Operations, I have visited and overseen federal disaster response in Hawaii, North Carolina, and Florida. I remain fully engaged here in Texas to ensure our communities have the resources and support needed for a full recovery.

For those in TX-17, the FEMA Individual Assistance program is available for Travis and Williamson counties. You can apply online at https://t.co/flPVpDMBSv or call 800-621-3362.

Today, I joined my Texas colleagues and the entire House of Representatives in a moment of silence to remember the lives lost and families affected by the tragic flooding in Texas. In times of mourning, our country stands united. God bless Texas.
🚨TUNE IN NOW @NEWSMAX 🚨 https://t.co/CaqY33e6Uj
Spoke to @LidiaNews @NEWSMAX on Saturday about why @GOPoversight's investigation needs to keep moving forward. The American people deserve the truth. https://t.co/Q2uSSIoHWw

Today, I am in Kerr County to survey the damage and recovery efforts. As Chairman of the Subcommittee on Government Operations, I have been closely engaged in federal disaster response efforts across the country. Now, that same need has emerged in Texas. I am working to ensure the Hill Country receives the resources and support needed to recover. God bless Texas.
🚨TUNE IN NOW🚨 Catch me this morning on @foxandfriends @FoxNews

Interested in serving your country through a future at a U.S. Service Academy? Join us in Round Rock for the 2025 Central Texas Service Academy Forum on Saturday, September 13, an informational event co-hosted by the Offices of Senator Cruz, Senator Cornyn, Congressman Sessions (TX-17), Congressman McCaul (TX-10), Congressman Carter (TX-31), and Congressman Doggett (TX-37).

Learn about the nomination process, speak with academy representatives, and get your questions answered.

For more information, contact Tori Magers from the Office of Congressman Pete Sessions at (254) 633-4500 or tori.magers@mail.house.gov.

The devastation we are seeing in Texas is overwhelming and heartbreaking. We continue to mourn with the families and loved ones of those lost. This is a time for unity, compassion, and getting the facts together.

In the face of tragedy, Texans remain steadfast in our resolve to help one another and work together toward recovery. This morning, I told @NEWSMAX that we’ve witnessed powerful acts of heroism across the Hill Country, and I am confident more stories of courage and compassion will emerge. My heart remains heavy for the lives lost, and I continue to pray for miracles.

I am heartbroken by the tragic flooding in the Hill Country. Our prayers are with those who have been lost, those still missing, and all the families affected. We pray for comfort, strength, and healing. May God also watch over the emergency response team and volunteers continuing their courageous efforts.

Today we celebrate the birth of the greatest nation on Earth, a country built on liberty, opportunity, and the promise of freedom. As we enjoy time with family and friends, let’s take pride in the American spirit that brings us together.

I’m proud to be an American, today and every day! 🇺🇸
Please see my statement regarding the One Big Beautiful Bill. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/OC5PFqtPJx

This morning, I joined @CNN before the Senate voted on the reconciliation bill. As the bill moves back to the House, I'm committed to securing our southern border, strengthening our military, and preventing a tax hike on hardworking Americans. https://t.co/bkS9tgzJPQ

June 25, 1996 was a night of unimaginable loss. 19 American Airmen lost their lives in a brutal act of terrorism at the Khobar Towers in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia. 

I have begun the process to introduce legislation to amend the 2015 United States Victims of State Sponsored Terrorism Act to authorize the release of long overdue benefits and recognition to the Khobar Tower bombing victims and survivors. May God bless the families of the fallen.

Last weekend, I had the honor of receiving the Distinguished Service Award from the Texas Rural Education Association. I’m truly grateful for this recognition, especially from an organization that does such important work for students and educators in rural communities.

TX-17 is home to some of the finest educators in the state, men and women who go above and beyond to ensure every child has access to a quality education. I’ll continue to stand with them and support the mission of strengthening rural education across Texas.

Glad to have @TxDOT in my office this week, following last week's ribbon cutting ceremony for East Wilco Highway Segment 3 in Williamson County. Texas depends on strong and modern transportation infrastructure. That is why it is critical that Congress works with TxDOT on reauthorization priorities to improve surface transportation. I look forward to continued collaboration with TxDOT.

Had a great morning with GATX and other fellow Texans at the Texas State Society Breakfast Club to discuss how Texas continues to lead the way in capitalism, industry, and innovation. GATX stands as a shining example by providing high-quality, skilled careers that support families and strengthen our community in TX-17. I am pleased to be invited to visit their facility in Hearne to see firsthand this model for how American companies can compete globally and build a stronger future.

I strongly believe in the mission and importance of the United States Postal Service. The USPS plays a critical role in keeping our communities connected and supporting commerce. Today, my subcommittee on Government Operations @GOPoversight met to discuss with key USPS stakeholders how the Postal Service can succeed in years ahead. It’s essential that we engage with stakeholders and understand their needs and concerns so that we can help ensure the USPS becomes more efficient and reliable.
TODAY my subcommittee on Government Operations will be examining the route forward to strengthen, streamline, and improve the USPS. Tune in at 1:00 PM EST.

Thank you, McLennan County, for showing up to last night’s town hall! We had a fantastic turnout, and I stayed until the last question was answered. Hearing directly from you about the issues that matter most is not just important, it’s essential. Your voice guides the work I do.

If you missed the event, you can find a full recording on my YouTube page.

TOMORROW I’m hosting a Town Hall from 6:00–7:30 PM at the Robinson Junior High School Cafetorium. Come share your thoughts, ask questions, and hear the latest updates from Washington and around TX-17.

Town Hall with Congressman Sessions
Monday, June 16, 6:00-7:30 PM
400 West Lyndale Dr, Robinson, TX

This Flag Day, we honor the adoption of the stars and stripes and proudly celebrate the 250th birthday of the United States Army. For two and a half centuries, the world’s finest fighting force has defended this beautiful flag and the freedoms it represents. God bless America, and God bless the United States Army.

Today, and as I always have, I stand in support of Israel. Targeting Iran’s nuclear program is a necessary show of strength against a dangerous regime that sponsors terrorism. Ultimately, this defends global security and advances peace through strength by removing their ability to create weapons of mass destruction.

Proud that HR 4, the Rescissions Act of 2025, of which I am a co-sponsor, has just passed the House, delivering $9.4 billion in cuts to restore fiscal discipline to Washington. I remain committed to protecting the taxpayer and advocating for common sense. 🇺🇸

Sanctuary states are anything but sanctuaries. They jeopardize public safety and endanger both Americans and illegal immigrants. Over 300,000 children are unaccounted for as a result of Biden’s open border policies and the “hospitality” of sanctuary cities and states. This is a staggering example of failed leadership. This isn’t compassion; it’s chaos. These policies are putting lives at risk.

@GOPoversight

I joined @Morning_Joe to discuss today’s @GOPoversight hearing with governors of sanctuary states. Regardless of whether the crime is violent, individuals in our country illegally who violate the law should be deported. Their continued presence poses a serious threat to public safety. Yet Governors Hochul, Walz, and Pritzker persist in allowing criminal illegal immigrants to remain on our streets, putting their own constituents at risk.

Criminal aliens, visa overstayers, denied asylum seekers, and individuals with final deportation orders have no legal right to remain in the United States. For years, ICE has exercised prosecutorial discretion in how deportation laws are enforced. @JonLemire’s assumption that it is wrong deport non-criminal illegal aliens misinterprets long-standing policy and ignores the rule of law.
🚨HAPPENING NOW🚨 Tune in on @MSNBC @Morning_Joe! https://t.co/kMxwXeFCeC

Great to meet with the President and CEO of Graphic Packaging today. We agree that Waco is a fantastic place to do business. Their recent $1.2 billion investment in a state-of-the-art manufacturing facility underscores that Waco is at the forefront for innovation and offers a high quality of life. Waco's strong workforce pipeline from our top-tier technical colleges and high schools has made this investment a smart and successful one.

It was a pleasure to welcome the @wacochamber to Washington this week. These community leaders are driving positive change in Waco through business and civic engagement. I appreciated hearing their insights on the challenges facing not only Wacoans, but Americans across the country. It is an honor to serve as their Congressman.

Glad to have my son Alex with me in Washington for the Congressional Baseball Game, this tradition is always a highlight of the summer. Looking forward to a great game tonight! https://t.co/4yvZ37DijS

Protecting Americans’ genetic data is critical, not only for individual privacy but also for the integrity of future research. Today, I participated in an @gopoversight  hearing to discuss the implications of 23andMe’s bankruptcy and what it means for the future of genetic information. As concerns grow over how this sensitive data may be handled or sold, it’s clear: Congress must act to ensure robust protections for consumers and their DNA.

McLennan County! I’m hosting a Town Hall next Monday, June 16 from 6:00–7:30 PM at the Robinson Junior High School Cafetorium. Come share your thoughts, ask questions, and hear the latest updates from Washington and around TX-17.

Town Hall with Congressman Sessions
Monday, June 16, 6:00-7:30 PM
400 West Lyndale Dr, Robinson, TX

Proud to see @SFASU lit up for National Naloxone Awareness Day. Grateful to my friends, the Siegels, for leading the charge to get life-saving naloxone into every first responder’s hands. Combating the opioid crisis in this country is essential to protecting lives and securing our future.
Congratulations to the Centerville Tigers! 2A State Champions! Excellence from TX-17.

Artificial intelligence is reshaping how we prevent fraud and modernize government operations. Today, I spoke during a @GOPoversight hearing about the critical role AI can play in improving efficiency, safeguarding taxpayer dollars, and strengthening trust in government. The future of good governance and zero fraud depends on innovation.
🚨Tune in NOW to @CNN🚨 @JohnBerman https://t.co/5Nsyx0cnBX

I was glad to have the National Association of Realtors in my DC office today. Texans know the American Dream starts with a place to call home. We must unlock supply, ease market constraints, and make it easier for families to find homes they can afford. https://t.co/nfnG9q5ZcJ
Congratulations to the Robinson Rockets Softball team! Making TX-17 proud. Go Rockets!

This Memorial Day, we honor the brave men and women who gave their lives to protect our freedom. Join me in remembering their sacrifice and the families who carry that loss every day. This is more than a day off from work; it is a solemn reminder of the cost of liberty. https://t.co/s2ZXSULpPP

As co-chair of the House DOGE Caucus, I’m committed to engaging with DOGE leaders across all federal agencies to promote efficiency and accountability in government operations. Yesterday, I met with Major Patrick George, who is leading DOGE in the Department of the Navy. Major George and his team of Navy personnel are examining every aspect of the service to make sure the Navy is operating at peak efficiency in support of the warfighter.
I voted "YES" on H.R. 1, One Big Beautiful Bill Act. https://t.co/4a0DdL8kFy

Yesterday, I sat down with @NAIFA to discuss their top priorities as financial services industry professionals. A key issue for NAIFA is extending President Trump's 2017 tax cuts, including the 199A deduction.

This deduction is vital for millions of small businesses that could face steep tax hikes if it expires. I’m committed to protecting American entrepreneurs and workers by supporting its extension. Small businesses are the backbone of our economy; we must move forward with extending these tax cuts to protect our entrepreneurs and strengthen our workforce.

As a strong advocate for blind and visually impaired Americans, I appreciated the opportunity to hear from the @natindblind. Their efforts help blind and visually impaired individuals have the tools they need to pursue meaningful employment.

Like me, NIB is committed to ensuring blind and visually impaired employees can keep up with technological advancements in today's rapidly evolving workforce. They support my bill, the Blind Americans Return to Work Act, which is designed to remove barriers to employment and help more blind and visually impaired Americans enter, and succeed in, the workforce.
Remembering my colleague Congressman Gerry Connolly. https://t.co/V9FKQfwCNG

I began this Police Week by meeting with members of the Texas Municipal Police Association. Representing over 33,500 law enforcement officers across Texas, TMPA plays a vital role in supporting our officers and promoting the highest standards of professionalism.

I'm deeply grateful for the men and women who serve and protect our communities and for organizations like TMPA that stand behind them.

Congratulations to Jake Pineda on his appointment into the United States Military Academy Class of 2029, where he will play baseball! Jake is an exceptional student and leader, and I look forward to all he will accomplish in service to our country. https://t.co/EaG2JOLt0b

This National Police Week, we honor the dedication, courage, and sacrifice of law enforcement officers who work to keep our communities safe. Thank you for your unwavering service. https://t.co/qGbffo5ZD3

Happy Mother’s Day to all the incredible moms in TX-17 and beyond. Your strength, compassion, and dedication shape not only your families but our entire community. Today we honor and thank you for everything you do, every single day. https://t.co/fNmi61ixqf

Today, Treasury Secretary @SecScottBessent testified before the @FinancialCmte.

This Administration has reversed Biden’s soft-on-China policies and brought 177,000 new private-sector jobs. We are now protecting American jobs and intellectual property, and I applauded the Secretary on his efforts so far.

I also asked about efforts to limit Russia’s fossil fuel revenues, which continue to fund their war in Ukraine. I am supportive of tougher sanctions that cut off that funding through this ongoing war.

I look forward to seeing continued American growth under the leadership of Secretary Bessent and this Administration.

Proud to announce this year's Congressional Art Competition overall winners for TX-17!

🥇 1st Place – “Bearing the Beauty of Old Glory” by Makenna Berry, Homeschool
🥈 2nd Place – “For Spacious Skies” by Abigail Olmstead, Homeschool
🥉 3rd Place – “Shooting Star” by Alicia Dowell, Nacogdoches High School

Makenna’s winning piece will be displayed in the Cannon Tunnel at the U.S. Capitol, where it will be seen by millions of people, including visitors, Members of Congress, and staff. Congratulations to all our talented young artists!
Celebrated 250 years of the @USPS today with the first Postmaster General, Benjamin Franklin! https://t.co/ODUzcWEaAO

Yesterday, I met with members of the Pandemic Accountability Response Committee (PRAC) to learn more about their fraud detection tools. As Chairman of the Subcommittee on Government Operations, I introduced the FACT Act (H.R. 2277) to extend PRAC’s vital work. The FACT Act passed unanimously out of @GOPoversight. I’m committed to continuing this bipartisan fight against fraud and ensuring accountability to the American taxpayer.

Last weekend, I had the opportunity to observe some of the amazing work of Camp Hope at Cross Creek Meadows in Thornton. Camp Hope is on the frontlines of caring for veterans living with PTSD and their families, offering a variety of services including equine therapy. Their dedication is a powerful example of the impact compassion and community can have on the healing journey.

It was great to be in Waco this morning to celebrate Allan Pahmiyer’s appointment into the United States Air Force Academy Class of 2029. Congratulations, Allan! Your character and leadership represents the very best of TX-17. https://t.co/1DMKMzv93f

Always a pleasure to have the @NDSS in my office! As the father of a young man with Down syndrome, I have seen firsthand the great work of this organization. I remain committed to legislation that supports Down syndrome Americans. https://t.co/L2wVlFbCjl

Great to speak to the @TexasFarmBureau this morning! As a proud 29-year member, I deeply appreciate the role the TFB plays in supporting our farmers and ranchers. I’m especially proud that TX-17 is home to the TFB headquarters, and I remain fully committed to championing Texas agriculture and the hardworking families who make it thrive.

Today, my subcommittee on @GOPoversight continued our review of the Department of Defense’s financial management challenges following seven failed audits. Ranking Member Mfume (@RepKweisiMfume) and I remain committed to bipartisan oversight that promotes fiscal responsibility and protects taxpayer dollars.

I’m encouraged by the U.S. Marine Corps’ clean audit and expect continued progress across the Department. Strong financial accountability is essential not only for the taxpayer but also for the DOD to know exactly how many bullets, guns, and tanks are ready to support the warfighter at a moment’s notice.

Today marks the 100th day of President Trump’s second term, and it has been an eventful start. Over this time, President Trump has exposed the cost to taxpayers of a government that stayed home. We’ve made progress, but reining in government spending remains a major challenge and I’m committed to finishing the job. @cnni
🚨 Tune into @cnni to hear my take on the first 100 days https://t.co/jzENotCRUm

I was amazed by the talent on display at Saturday’s Heart of Texas Congressional Art Competition. The theme, “America, the Beautiful,” inspired great creativity in high school artists across the Heart of Texas region of TX-17. 

Congratulations to all our winners!
🥇 1st Place – “For Spacious Skies” by Abigail Olmstead, Homeschool 
🥈 2nd Place – “Memoirs of an American Childhood” by Megan Ward, Groesbeck High School
🥉 3rd Place – “Bright and Bold” by Arisbeida Barcenas Perez, Chilton High School
🏅 4th Place – “From Sea to Shining Sea” by Abigail Olmstead, Homeschool
🏅 5th Place – “U.S. Marine” by Landry Rosenbaum, Chilton High School
🏅 6th Place – “Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Happiness” by Senon Gonzalez, Chilton High School

Thank you to all who entered and helped make this event meaningful!

What an honor it was to read "Peter Rabbit" at the 2025 White House Easter Egg Roll! It was a privilege to share this beloved story and celebrate the season with families from across the nation. https://t.co/KgIOYLi7mT

Great to be out at the grand opening of the new MGM and VanTran Transformers manufacturing facility in Waco! CEO Doug Banty and the entire MGM and VanTran team are exemplifying excellence in American manufacturing. This opportunity will create high-paying jobs, foster innovation, and ensure that Texas remains at the forefront of energy advancements. I look forward to seeing the positive impact this will have on our community.

This weekend, come celebrate the incredible talent of TX-17’s high school artists in Waco and view some of this year’s entries for the Congressional Art Competition!

📍 Waco – 11:00 AM
701 S 8th St, Waco, TX 76706

This year’s theme is “America the Beautiful,” and I can’t wait to see the creativity and passion our local students have put into their work.

The horrific terrorist attack in India is both heartbreaking and unacceptable. I strongly condemn these senseless acts of violence. The United States stands united with India in our commitment to opposing terrorism and defending peace and security around the world.

Last Wednesday, I held a town hall meeting in Huntsville. It was a great time to hear from constituents and share about what I do for them in Washington. I’m grateful for the respectful and thoughtful conversations we had, whether we agreed or not, it was encouraging to see a shared commitment to open dialogue. Big day in the House! We just passed the budget resolution — the first step in delivering President Trump’s America First agenda.

We also passed the SAVE Act today.

American elections must be decided by American citizens.

The Safeguard American Voter Eligibility Act will:
🇺🇸 Remove non-citizens from voter rolls
🇺🇸 Require proof of U.S. citizenship to register to vote
🇺🇸 Empower citizens to hold officials accountable

This is a crucial step to protect our democracy for future generations.

Hemp-derived intoxicants like Delta-8 THC pose serious public health risks. Between 2021 and February 2025, U.S. poison control centers handled 10,263 cases involving Delta-8 THC exposures. Even more troubling, these products are often marketed in ways that appeal directly to children. I personally confronted the General Counsel of the Hemp Roundtable for their continued support of companies that sell and promote addictive hemp products to children. Candy-like items such as Triple Strength THC Watermelon Lemonade Space Chews have no place on the market and should be banned outright.

@GOPoversight

Today, I met with the Deep East Texas Council of Governments to discuss the critical need to reauthorize the Secure Rural Schools and Communities (SRS) Act.

For over 100 years, 25% of revenue from National Forests has gone back to counties for essential services like public schools and roads. Now, the SRS has expired and requires reauthorization by Congress.

TX-17 is home to three beautiful National Forests and the rural counties that surround them. I am a cosponsor of H.R. 1383 to reauthorize the SRS to strengthen and support our rural communities.
Tune in on @siriusxmpotus this morning!

It is crucial that we pass legislation to rein in illicit financial activity to protect Americans.

Enjoyed my time at the Flying Jacks Aviator’s Ball on Saturday! The Flying Jacks aviation program at @SFASU  is rapidly growing and providing students with top-tier aviation education and training. Yesterday, my bill, H.R. 2277, the Federal Accountability for Transparency (FACT) Act, unanimously passed out of the @GOPoversight markup!

This bipartisan bill, co-led with my Democratic colleague @RepKweisiMfume , extends the authorization of the Pandemic Response Accountability Committee (PRAC) through 2026. The PRAC was originally established to combat fraud during the COVID-19 pandemic but is currently set to sunset and begin destroying critical data this summer.

With billions of taxpayer dollars lost to fraud, the fight to recover these funds is far from over. H.R. 2277 ensures the PRAC has more time to investigate and hold fraudsters accountable.

I am proud to be a longtime leader in preventing fraud and improper payments. Next stop for this legislation is the House floor!

In today’s @FinancialCmte hearing, we discussed the unbalanced disparity of access to capital across America. Texas is one of the fastest-growing states in both population and economic output yet receives only 2-3% of national venture capital investment. 75% of all venture capital investment flows to only three states--California, New York, and Massachusetts.

This imbalance limits opportunities for high-potential startups and emerging industries across our great state. To keep Texas on the cutting edge, we must adopt successful models from across the country and boldly pursue new strategies that empower our entrepreneurs, strengthen local economies, and ensure Texas remains a national leader in innovation. Texas has the talent, vision, and potential. It is time to ensure the necessary resources follow.

Today marks the anniversary of the fall of the Alamo, an event of legend in Texas history. The courage of the nearly 200 men who stood their ground against overwhelming odds has inspired generations of Texans. "Remember the Alamo" is more than a battle cry; it is a symbol of the resolute fight for freedom.

Today, the mayors of Boston, New York City, Denver, and Chicago testified before @GOPoversight about their status as "sanctuary cities." While the responsibility of any mayor should be ensuring the safety and well-being of their residents, these mayors are compromising that duty by refusing to cooperate with federal law enforcement agencies and harboring illegal aliens. Rather than offering sanctuary, these cities are teeming with danger for their residents. I hope that after our conversation today, these mayors will be open to working with us to make America's cities SAFE again.

In his first term, President Trump delivered monumental tax cuts to the American people. But now, there are 142 legislative days left to prevent a massive tax hike.

If we don't renew Trump's tax cuts, in ONE YEAR we will face:

Average taxpayer hit with a 22% tax hike
Death Tax exemption cut for 2M family farms
Standard deduction halved for 91% of taxpayers
26M small businesses burdened with a 43.4% top rate—higher than China!

It's time to act and protect hardworking Americans.
Looking forward to continuing in this important work with Chairman @RepJamesComer and my Oversight colleagues!

This week, I spoke on the importance of federal nutrition programs for Central Texas at the 2024 Prosper Waco Summit. Prosper Waco is dedicated to improving education, health, and financial security for our community, and as a proud Waco native, I enjoyed sharing my insights. I highlighted the role of the Farm Bill, which many view as primarily focused on agriculture, but is actually the largest piece of federal legislation supporting food security. The Nutrition Title of the Farm Bill is crucial for enhancing access for families and modernizing food distribution. I am fully supportive of the Farm Bill and the potential impact it has in our communities.

I was honored to be named Legislator of the Year by the Texas Forestry Association! The timber industry plays a vital role in supporting all sectors by providing essential materials. Many communities in TX-17 rely on forestry-related jobs. I'm proud of my record in supporting legislation that protects private landowners and promotes clean, healthy, and productive forest ecosystems!

Today’s attack in Turkey is a stark reminder of the persistent threat terrorism poses to global stability. As a NATO ally, Turkey has our full support during this difficult time. We stand united with our partners against those who use violence to undermine peace and security.

It was an honor to spend time with the Leroy/Axtell Volunteer Fire Department this afternoon, and I am incredibly grateful for their service to our rural McLennan County community. The dedication of these volunteers, who make personal sacrifices to ensure the safety of our residents, is truly inspirational. Thank you for welcoming me and for everything you do to protect us all!

Enjoyed getting to ride in Nexio's propane-based bobtail truck! This cutting-edge technology will grow supply chain productivity by reducing fuel costs for heavy-duty vehicles while promoting the domestic production of LNG. Proud to see Nexio leading the way for propane-based engine innovation right here from TX-17.

Exciting day in Lufkin! I had the honor of attending the ribbon-cutting for the Lufkin Forward initiative. This project is revitalizing downtown with pedestrian-friendly improvements that will foster community and boost local businesses. Lufkin is a beautiful community, and I can’t wait to see the positive impact of this initiative for generations to come!

This week, I was able to tour the facilities of West Fraser and Bakelite Synthetics in Lufkin and Nacogdoches, where I learned about the innovative processes behind these essential products and their use in various industries. These two manufacturers are among the thousands that would be negatively impacted by the EPA's nonsensical formaldehyde ruling. I questioned the EPA director over their proposal back in July and urged him to rescind the ruling in order to protect the American economy and restore basic economic sense. It is crucial to oppose EPA’s regulatory overreach that would level our industrial landscape.

Yesterday, I had the privilege of beginning my annual tour of agricultural operations throughout TX-17. Alongside members of my staff, I visited local farms to connect directly with our farmers and hear about their vital work. It was invaluable to gain insights about how I can better support them from Washington. Our producers are the backbone of this nation, and I am proud to represent so many hardworking individuals who contribute to our community and economy. I am dedicated to the advancement of resources and policies that support our agricultural sector.

It was a pleasure to share a meal with McLennan County Community College President McKown and her McKown Scholars. Hearing their innovative ideas and perspectives on the pressing issues facing our community and nation was truly inspiring. Engaging with these future leaders gives me great confidence that our future is bright and secure.

I had a great time as the keynote speaker at the Joy Club luncheon hosted by First Methodist Church Waco! I shared my insights on the future of AI and its potential in healthcare, education, navigation, and security. Embracing new technologies is essential, but we must ensure AI is implemented with care and proper oversight for safety and accountability. Together, we can harness these innovations for a brighter future.

I had the honor of participating in the dedication of a new plaque at the Limestone County Courthouse, generously provided by the Alamo Letter Society. This plaque features the text of Col. William B. Travis's renowned "Victory or Death" letter, written during the Siege of the Alamo in 1836. Travis's words continue to inspire Texans today, and I commend the Alamo Letter Society for their dedication to educating Texans about the bravery and sacrifice of our forefathers.

I had an amazing experience as the Honorary Chairman at the second annual Community Field Day hosted by the Baylor Center for Developmental Disabilities and the National Down Syndrome Society! Youth and adults with developmental disabilities, along with their families, gathered at McLane Stadium to enjoy a variety of field games organized in stations by local disability organizations, all while learning about the importance of maintaining an active lifestyle. It was truly inspiring to witness the community unite in celebration of the joy of being active.
